title: Unlocked Pixel 3 accidentally got "locked" on Japanese SoftBank network
content:
Hi! I'm having a serious problem with my pixel 3's network connection.
I bought my pixel 3 unlocked on amazon.jp while living in Japan for a year (july 2018-june 2019), and was connected through the company "Mobal" with a SIM-card that worked on a SoftBank network. The subscription has been terminated and was always possible to terminate immediately. However, I have now bought a new SIM-card in my home country (Sweden) and when inserting it I get a message saying: "SIM card isn't supported. Ask SoftBank whether this device can be unlocked". But when I contacted SoftBank they told me: 

"Please find our policy of unlocking the handset.
You can have your handset unlocked only if:

1)You are currently the subscriber of the mobile number.
2)You were ex-subscriber, but the subscription has been 
terminated within 90 days.
3)The handset should be purchased through Softbank shops
or Softbank online shops by yourself.

Since you don't meet the conditions, you cannot have your
handset unlocked by us."

So they are apparently not able to find any indication that my phone was connected through their network, since I was a subscriber through another company. 

Does anyone have any idea about how to solve this this problem? Has anyone else experienced this kind of problem?? It's super frustrating!
